root.name: Sonic the Hedgehog 4: Episode II
root.description: Episode MetalSonic The Hedgehog 4: Episode II returns to plot threads from Sonic CD, which, fiittingly, was released digitally in the time between Episode I and Episode II's release. Metal Sonic returns to the franchise, and is even playable in Episode Metal. Mimicking the Lock-On Technology created for Sonic Knuckles, owners of both episodes on a single platform (whether it be PS3, Xbox 360, etc) can unlock Episode Metal, in which the players play as Metal Sonic and go through the four zones from Sonic 4 Episode I in reverse order.New Graphic and Gameplay EnginesFollowing criticism from the first title, Episode II features a new graphic engine and gameplay engine. However, despite this, Episode II has been criticized for still being too similar to Sonic The Hedgehog 4: Episode I, and not accurately enough recreating the physics of the classic Sonic titles. One of the criticism is that rolling down a downhill slope causes Sonic to come to a stop, rather than increasing momentum.MultiplayerWith the return of Tails to the title, the game now has co-operative play for 2 players. This is similar to how 2 players can play cooperatively in the classic Sonic titles Sonic The Hedgehog 2, Sonic The Hedgehog 3, Knuckles Chaotix, and even Sonic Knuckles if connected to Sonic The Hedgehog 3.In addition to being able to play alone or with another player on the same screen, Sonic The Hedgehog 4: Episode II even can be played cooperatively online, a series first.Xbox Live Avatar ItemsFor Xbox 360 players, multiple avatar items were released for purchase on the Xbox Live Marketplace.
